name: Sneha Kumar Kasera
content: Sneha Kasera Faculty Site Skip to content Sneha Kumar Kasera Associate Dean for Academic Affairs, John and Marcia Price College of Engineering Professor, Kahlert School of Computing Academic Chair, Stena Center for Financial Technology About me: I joined the University of Utah in 2003. From 1999-2003, I was a member of technical staff in the Mobile Networking Research Department of Bell Laboratories. Earlier, I received a PhD in Computer Science from the University of Massachusetts Amherst (advisors: Jim Kurose and Don Towsley), and a master's degree in Electrical Communication Engineering from the Indian Institute of Science Bangalore (advisor: Utpal Mukherji). Research I am leading the Advanced Networked Systems Research (ANSR) Lab that I founded in 2003. My research interests include networks and systems - technologies, protocols and applications encompassing mobile and pervasive systems and wireless networks, artificial intelligence, security, privacy, and reliability, sensing, crowdsourcing, dynamic spectrum access, software-defined radios, network resource management, network measurements and models.
